@ondawoad The problem with neo-feudalism is that it most likely will result in the extinction of the human species over time

@ondawoad It took me 8 years of research to figure this out and essentially proposes we have two choices moving forward, but in political terms collectivism = socialism (but not ur grandfather‚Äôs version)

@ondawoad Technosocialist-capitalism? Doesn‚Äôt really make sense. Secondarily, the mission of corporations does serve the social good in equal parts with the markets, prioritizing technology that works for the collective good and not just tech that generates profits.

@ondawoad It‚Äôs definitely collectivist in nature, but it breaks the central premise of socialism (ie workers owning the means of production). But it is still closer to socialism that any other political classification. What would you call it?

@ondawoad An economy that is aligned with the greater good (i.e social needs over market) and uses technology to reduce the cost of government to its optimal minimum, means the means of production at an economy level are prioritized to the citizens it serves. Technosocialism still fits.
